Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: stow

Arguments.Name: -n
Arguments.Description: Do not perform any operations that modify the filesystem; merely show what would happen

Arguments.Name: -d
Arguments.Description: Set the stow directory to 'DIR' instead of the current directory. This also has the effect of making the default target directory be the parent of 'DIR'

Arguments.Name: DIR
Arguments.Description: DIR

Arguments.Name: -t
Arguments.Description: Set the target directory to 'DIR' instead of the parent of the stow directory

Arguments.Name: DIR
Arguments.Description: DIR

Arguments.Name: -v
Arguments.Description: Send verbose output to standard error describing what Stow is doing. Verbosity levels are from 0 to 5; 0 is the default. Using '-v' or '--verbose' increases the verbosity by one; using `--verbose=N' sets it to N

Arguments.Name: level
Arguments.Description: level
level
level
level
level
level
level

Arguments.Name: -S
Arguments.Description: Stow the packages that follow this option into the target directory. This is the default action and so can be omitted if you are only stowing packages rather than performing a mixture of stow/delete/restow actions

Arguments.Name: -D
Arguments.Description: Unstow the packages that follow this option from the target directory rather than installing them

Arguments.Name: -R
Arguments.Description: Restow packages (first unstow, then stow again). This is useful for pruning obsolete symlinks from the target tree after updating the software in a package

Arguments.Name: --adopt
Arguments.Description: This behaviour is specifically intended to alter the contents of your stow directory.  If you do not want that, this option is not for you

Arguments.Name: --no-folding
Arguments.Description: Disable folding of newly stowed directories when stowing, and refolding of newly foldable directories when unstowing

Arguments.Name: --ignore
Arguments.Description: Ignore files ending in this Perl regex

Arguments.Name: REGEX
Arguments.Description: REGEX

Arguments.Name: --defer
Arguments.Description: Don't stow files beginning with this Perl regex if the file is already stowed to another package

Arguments.Name: REGEX
Arguments.Description: REGEX

Arguments.Name: --override
Arguments.Description: Force stowing files beginning with this Perl regex if the file is already stowed to another package

Arguments.Name: REGEX
Arguments.Description: REGEX

Arguments.Name: --dotfiles
Arguments.Description: Enable special handling for 'dotfiles' (files or folders whose name begins with a period) in the package directory. If this option is enabled, Stow will add a preprocessing step for each file or folder whose name begins with 'dot - ', and replace the 'dot- ' prefix in the name by a period (.). This is useful when Stow is used to manage collections of dotfiles, to avoid having a package directory full of hidden files

Arguments.Name: -V
Arguments.Description: Show Stow version, and exit

Arguments.Name: -h
Arguments.Description: Show Stow command syntax, and exit
